main event: A single red flare was sighted at 42°19'N 63°51'W at 22:46Z on January 6, 1957. Nothing else was seen after that.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 1 minute.
The objects were following a unit course.
The report is described as a 'poor report'.
The case is from Project Blue Book records.
location: 250 miles east of Boston, Massachusetts, in the Atlantic Ocean
